... sicer kogar to zanima, en fajn vir je javier blas od
bloombrega, ki pokriva ze dolgo podrocje energije - twitter.com/JavierBlas/

na hitro o sedanjem stanju:

According to Javier Blas of Bloomberg, at the start of the year,
Russia was earning $350 million per day from oil and $200 million
per day from gas. On March 3 2022 Europe paid $720 million to
Russia for gas alone.

tudi ce ne bi slo za piarovsko-politicni problem "kupuje od rusov",
tezko prodas na hitro tako glomazo - kot je ze opisano v
nadaljevanju twita, ki si ga podal.

edini resen zmagovalec sedanje situacije je verjetno
kitajska.

pa to koristno navodilo je res koristno:

I see lots of interest in getting Gold at 20% off in Twitterverse.
One asked how. Let me explain:

You'd need to personally show up in Moscow with cash since bank
transfers don't work. And there are no planes. All of your cash
will be stolen at the border as you enter Russia.

author: P46000

content:
Stvari so kompleksne. Kitajci in Rusi se ne marajo. ...en.wikipedia.org/wik...r_conflict



"On 15 March, the Soviets dispatched another 30 soldiers and six
combat vehicles to Zhenbao Island. After an hour of fighting, the
Chinese had destroyed two of the Soviet vehicles. A few hours
later, the Soviets sent a second wave with artillery support. The
Chinese destroyed five more Soviet combat vehicles. A third wave
was repulsed by effective Chinese artillery, which destroyed one
Soviet tank and four APCs and damaged two other APCs.[citation
needed] By the end of the day, with the Chinese in full control of
the island[citation needed], Soviet General Oleg Losik ordered to
deploy then-secret BM-21 "Grad" multiple rocket launchers. The
Soviets fired 10,000 artillery rounds in a nine-hour engagement
with the Chinese along with 36 sorties.[7] The attack was
devastating for the Chinese troops and materiel. Chinese troops
left their positions on the island, and the Soviets withdrew to
their positions on the Russian bank of the Ussuri
River.[25][18]

On 16 March 1969, the Soviets entered the island to collect their
dead. The Chinese held their fire. On 17 March 1969, the Soviets
tried to recover a disabled T-62 tank from the island, but their
effort was repelled by Chinese artillery.[19]

On 21 March, the Soviets sent a demolition team attempting to
destroy the tank. The Chinese opened fire and thwarted the
Soviets.[19] With the help of divers of the Chinese navy, the PLA
pulled the T-62 tank onshore. The tank was later given to the
Chinese Military Museum.

Until 1991, the island remained contested."
author: XZDRA4

content:
[0126Bacis]
Ruska vlada je bankrotirala in potrebuje denar čim prej.
Imajo ogromno zalog zlata, zato so mislili, da bo to zadostovalo
vsaj za nekaj časa.
Vendar trenutno nihče ni pripravljen kupiti ruskega zlata - znižali
so ceno za 20 % pa skoraj ne najdejo kupcev.

twitter.com/igorsush...8188346373

Glede zlata je tako, da so največji ljubitelji zlata že ves čas v
dveh državah, ki slišita na ime Indija in Kitajska. Oni ga porabijo
vsaj pol na svetu.

In tam ga kupujejo tudi in predvsem fizično. In tudi iz očitnih
razlogov neradi razglašajo naokoli da so kupili zlato.
Tako da za to, da na tem svetu fizično zlato ne bi našlo kjupca se
ni za bati.

Kar se tiče bankrota Rusije prvič slišim me pa zanima za kaj
konkretno bi naj oni po tvojem tako nujno potrebovali denar? Kaj
naj bi rabili kupovati in od koga?
Hvala za odgovor
author: 1127DXSXU

content:
Hmmm, bančniki in finančniki pač ne vidijo dlje od svojih
klimatiziranih pisarn in velikoh foteljev.

Država ne more bankrotirati !!!

Še posebej ne Rusija !

To so mokre sanje Amerov in vseh njihovih podrepnikov in
proameriško usmerjeniuh politikov !

Večina ljudi v Rusiji sploh ne ve, da je v Ukrajini vojna.

Imajo svoje rublje in za njihov denar kupijo njihovo domačo pšenico
in domač kruh za svoj denar po ceni, ki jo sami želijo !!!

Energije imajo več kot dovolj !!!!!!!!

Kaj komu ni jasno ?????

Tisto, kar bodo pa potrebovali pa bodo nabavili od Kitajcev po taki
ceni in s tako valuto, kot se bodo sami med seboj dogovorili
!!!

In spet se zahod meče na trepalnice, ker jim ni uspel veliki met
!!!!

Hudo je, kot sem na začetku zapisal, ko eni vidijo življenje samo s
svoje prspektive in ne poznajo in ne razumejo, da življenje drugje
po svetu teče bistveno drugače.

EU in še posebej njeni prebivalci pa že plačujemo ceno tega spora
med ZDA in Rusijo !

Ukrajina pa je itak kolateralna škoda !

Ameri se na vse pretege trudijo, da v vojno zvlečejo še EU ampak
jim to na srečo ne uspeva !

Hvala Bogu, da imamo v EU Macrona !!!

mogel nadaljevati vojne v Ukrajini ... khmm, razen če Putin enako
kot vsakodnevna potrošniška jajca - zaradi sankcij jih itak ne more

Putin tudi svojo vojsko plačuje z zelenim papirjem in zaradi

se lačni in žejni vojaki v najbližjem McDonald'su lahko končno spet
pošteno najedli slastnih Big-Macov in napili Coca-Cole ... alzo, če
skrajšam, bankrot Rusije v smislu težav s financiranjem vojne v
Ukrajini je čisti bulšit "demokratičnih" propagandistov, ki sami

P.S.: da ne bo pomote, toti komentar nima nobene zveze z mojim

naših "Fuck the EU" prijateljev na oni strani velike luže, ki so z

zmagali že danes, čeprav v resnici noben ne ve, koliko časa bo
vojna še trajala in če bo ostala samo v Ukrajini ...
author: najobj

content:
[]
Država ne more bankrotirati ...
Na Quori Digest so pisali o državi, ki bankrotira.

Q: Why isn't Russia going bankrupt?

A: Russia will go bankrupt next month. They have 30 days of grace
on their loans, but next month they will be in default. The US, the
EU, and the UK have successfully frozen most of their money
reserves, something Putin didn’t believe they could do. They can
only pay if it is not in US dollars, Euros, or British pounds. That
leaves not much money, mostly gold. This is going to be an
extremely bad experience for Russians since they have not gone
bankrupt since 1917. They don’t remember what it is like. It
will be bad like 1917. About 200,000 educated Russians have already
fled the country, but for the rest, it is time to get out. They
don’t want to be the last rat off a sinking ship.
author: aimon
